titleStmt.title: An elegy on the death of that brave sea-commander, Reer-Admiral Carter, who was unfortunately kill'd in the famous ingagement with the French fleet, on the 20th of May, 1692.
titleStmt.author: Ames, Richard, d. 1693.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Amidst the publick joy, which every where,".
Attributed to Richard Ames by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
